HWindowBar

HWindowBar responds to drag passthrough drag events and is responsible for displaying the HWindowLabel and misc window header stuff, like close, zoom and minimize buttons.

It’s also used to show the themeable background for the title/header area of windows.  Use HWindowControl as the interface, don’t use the HWindowBar directly.

Summary
HWindowBar
HWindowBar responds to drag passthrough drag events and is responsible for displaying the HWindowLabel and misc window header stuff, like close, zoom and minimize buttons.
Instance variables
constructor
Basically just a passthrough for <HButton.constructor> it only differs by making sure drag events are registered.

type’[HWindowBar]’

<HButton>

NOTE

HWindow -components are still evolving.

Basically just a passthrough for <HButton.constructor> it only differs by making sure drag events are registered.  Nothing special, constructed by HWindowControl
Generated by Natural Docs
HWindowLabel responds to drag passthrough drag events and is responsible for displaying the label of the HWindowBar.
constructor: function(_rect,
_parentClass,
_options)
Basically just a passthrough for HButton.constructor it only differs by making sure drag events are registered.
HWindowControl (with alias HWindow) is the main component of the HWindow classes.
HWindowView has no logic functionality at except basic View management inherited from HView.
